title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Current and former Boeing directors have reached an agreement to settle a shareholder lawsuit that claimed the company's board failed to properly oversee safety matters related to the 737 MAX.

Alphabet's Google has invested $1 billion in futures-exchange operator CME Group and struck a deal to move the company's core trading systems to the cloud.

Tesla and Hertz are negotiating over how quickly Hertz will receive deliveries from a bulk order of 100,000 Tesla electric cars.

Uber achieved an important measure of profitability for the first time since its inception more than a decade ago.

OPEC and a group of Russia-led producers agreed to keep to their gradual, monthly increase in oil output.

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq rose 0.4% and 0.8%, respectively, to close at records, while the Dow fell 0.1%.

Lions Gate is considering unloading its Starz premium-cable channel.

What's News: Business & Finance
